content.webTitle: TV tonight: a gripping end to a 9/11 drama that’s unafraid to point the finger

fields.headline: TV tonight: a gripping end to a 9/11 drama that’s unafraid to point the finger
fields.bodyText: The Looming Tower 9pm, BBC Two Writers Ali Selim and Dan Futterman deserve awards (as do the actors Jeff Daniels and Tahar Rahim) for this elegiac coda to what has been a consistently compelling 10-part adaptation of Lawrence Wright’s book of the same name. A gripping finale, intercut with real footage from 9/11, weaves the narrative threads together to reveal the echoing irony of how the events of that fateful day in 2001 could have been avoided had the CIA shared vital information about al-Qaida with the FBI. A gobsmacking indictment of US foreign policy. Mike Bradley Glastonbury 2019 7.30pm, BBC Two Coverage of the opening day of the festival kicks off with performances from the R&B star Jorja Smith, flamenco-pop diva Rosalía and the Tyneside troubadour Sam Fender, followed, at 9.50pm, by the headlining set from Stormzy. Plus, at 10pm on BBC Four, you can catch lush Australian psych-popsters Tame Impala. MB Celebrity Crystal Maze 8pm, Channel 4 Richard Ayoade maintains an air of arch-eyebrowed detachment as he guides the assembled celebs round the maze. Captain Anita Rani has a mixed bunch on her hands, with Friday Night Dinner’s Tom Rosenthal, Paralympian Hannah Cockroft, presenter Jeff Stelling and Strictly’s AJ Pritchard all featuring. Hannah Verdier When Buildings Collapse: World’s Worst Engineering Disasters 8pm, Channel 5 Engineer Rob Bell agonises over dramatic footage of bridges, floors and walkways fatally crumbling. Amid a fair bit of repetition, Bell does provide interesting scientific explanations – and uncovers a Grenfell-esque flaw in the construction of a London tower block. Jack Seale Code 37: Sex Crimes 9pm, More4 This week’s dispatch from the Ghent police’s sex crimes unit is another tense investigation involving the hunt for a masked serial rapist who assaults women in their homes. Boss Hannah has her suspicions, as do the team, but she is the only one with the wit and wherewithal to set a trap for the perpetrator. MB Bruce Lee and the Outlaw 9pm, PBS America In the underground ducts of Bucharest a band of children and their drug-dealing Fagin-figure – “Bruce Lee”, the “King of the Underworld” – redefine the meaning of family. For six years, Joost Vandebrug embedded himself in their way of life, resulting in this multi-award-winning documentary. Ali Catterall Film choice Berlin Express, 6am, Movies4Men Set amid the wreckage of postwar Germany, this 1948 drama has representatives of the four occupying powers fighting to save German democrat Paul Lukas from a gang of Nazis. Merle Oberon and Robert Ryan are the French and American members of the quartet, in a grim, vérité portrait of a devastated nation. Paul Howlett Sport choice Tennis: Eastbourne The semi-finals from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club. 1pm, BBC Two Women’s World Cup Football The winners of the fourth and fifth last-16 matches face off. 7.30pm, BBC Four Women’s International Rugby Union: England v USA Women’s Rugby Super Series match from San Diego, California. 8.30pm, Sky Sports Action
